content: the back panel on their side to make the leg holes 4 with seams on the outside sew the rear seam together green lines 5 sew the bottom part of the seam to create the leg holes and then flip the shorts right side out this should be able to be done in one seam finish the top when you put this rough pair of shorts on you ll see that a they are low cut in the back b they are big in the waist you ll add row just in the back to take care of the dip in the back first then you ll add a waistband that will make the shorts fit perfectly at the waist look great and still be flexible to even out the back you ll need to work a few row from side seam to side seam across the top of the back closing the dip in the back dark purple panel shown below there are about 76 80 84 88 stitches from side seam to side seam across the back now that you ve stitched up the butt crack part you re making a triangle by crocheting across the back making shorter stitches towards each side and taller stitches toward the middle continuing until you are comfortable with the height row 1 attach yarn at the waist seam single_crochet 20 21 22 23 half_double_crochet 9 10 11 12 double_crochet 18 half_double_crochet 9 10 11 12 single_crochet 20 21 22 23 turn total of 76-88 stitches row 2 sl 5 single_crochet 12 13 14 15 half_double_crochet 13 14 15 16 double_crochet 16 half_double_crochet 13 14 15 16 single_crochet 12 13 14 15 turn total of 71-83 stitches you are ending 5 stitches before seam row 3 sl 4 single_crochet 10 11 12 13 half_double_crochet 15 16 17 18 double_crochet 12 half_double_crochet 15 16 17 18 single_crochet 10 11 12 13 total of 66-74 stitches you are ending 4 stitches before the end of your scs from previous row finish off or turn depending on your preference row 4 and so on if you want continue in the same way working shorter stitches towards the edges and taller stitches toward the middle and working symmetrically waistband cut a strip of elastic that fits comfortably around your wearer s waist at their desired snugness plus ½ for overlap when sewing the ends together into a circle set aside now you will be working around the entire top of the shorts in rounds not going back and forth row 1 attach your yarn in any stitch in the back of the shorts half_double_crochet in every other stitch around the top of the shorts when you get to the front panels half_double_crochet in two stitches in a row then skip one around you should end up with about 95 half_double_crochet there are 168 total stitches the exact amount of stitches no longer matters for the rest of the pattern slip_stitch to close do not turn row
